pullRequest.body:
This PR ensures that the new docstring added by `extend_docs` is always persisted across imports.

The docstring extension maintains a `List (Name √ó String)` alongside a `NameMap String`; the `NameMap` is used for state, while the `List` is used for exports. `addDocString` calls out to a function which implicitly assumes that no docstring is being added twice, and simply prepends the new entry to the `List`, regardless of whether the name already appears in a pair there. A `qsort` with respect to the name which is used during serialization then might rearrange the entries. After import, when we conduct binary search through the entries associated with the module to retrieve the docstring, we might land on the wrong one.

See [Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/extend_docs.20persistence.20issue)

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by adomani.
I think I might try fixing this in core. I ran into a similar issue this week with another extension.

Although a slight misuse of the tag, I've added "blocked by core PR" for now to "hit pause" on this PR. If the core PR lands, I'll close this one. But if the core PR is expected to take too long to land and propagate to Mathlib (hopefully not!), maybe we ought to merge this one in the meantime. I'll let the maintainers decide. :)

That's as far as I can give suggestions to this PR!  :smile:
Oops, I too thought that was showing the diff to my changes, not the diff to the base! EDIT: wait, is that what happened? I'm confused by what GitHub did there... üòÖ
I'm not sure about what happened: I selected the *two* line breaks and removed *one* in the suggestion.  Maybe, I should have selected *one* line break and removed it?
The source of your suggestion looks sensible! Hmm, maybe GitHub trims whitespace at a point it shouldn't? Or something? Either way, I'm blaming this on a bug... üòÅ

pullRequest.title: fix: make `extend_docs` always persist new docstrings across imports
